result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexx John Ohara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

SAFE intake program and follow through.  AODA and any follow through.  

DNA sample. 

60/90/120 probation review hearings. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexx John Ohara

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 3:36 pm. 
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears via zoom, and with Attorney Natasha VanLieshout via zoom.
VRCW. 

Date and time set for FPT; parties are prepared to move forward with a plea and sentencing today.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to: 
DRI Ct.2; 
DRI Ct.3; 

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.1>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation; CONDITIONS: 45 days MCJ, 30 days STAYED for rule violations.  I/S 30 hours community service for rule violations.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. SAFE intake program and follow through.  AODA and any follow through.  Pay CC/DV surcharge.  Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 60, 90, and 120 day Probation Review Hearings. 

COURT grants 25 days credit. 
Probation Review Hearing set for 12/9 at 1:15 pm. 

Adj: 3:46 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance

Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 10:40 am.

No contact with victim(s): E.A.K. or residence.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Wausau PD).  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.
